content: sort of half circle shawl materials needed  fingering weight yarn 450 yds minimum more if you like a bigger shawl  i hook  yarn needle for weaving ends when crocheting this shawl it is important to understand the construction of a flat crocheted circle to crochet a flat circle you usually start with a ch4 that you join into a circle or you can use a technique called magic_ring which is just a loop of yarn that you work your stitches into and then pull the tail to cinch the loop tight i prefer magic_ring as i think it looks neater to make a flat circle you begin with 12dc in the magic_ring every round thereafter you increase by 12 sts evenly around the circle round 2 works an increase 2dc worked into a single stitch in every stitch for a total count of 24 sts round 3 works an increase in every other stitch for a total count of 36 sts and so on this shawl is based on that formula but with some modifications the ch1 spaces that make the spokes are to help you keep track of when increases are needed be sure that you keep an eye on where these spaces fall after your eyelet row as they can be easy to miss all of your increases will come either at the start of the row or after the ch1 space each wedge of the shawl will begin with an increase 2dc in the first st on an eyelet row your increase will be worked a little differently the bulk of the eyelet row are double_crochet ch1 skip 1 st double_crochet in next st on your increase you won t do the skip 1 st the increase will be double_crochet in first st of wedge chain 1 double_crochet in next st you ll know if you did it wrong because when you hit the end of the wedge you ll have an extra stitch also if you follow my patterns you ll know that i m a big fan of the no turning chain double_crochet video can be found on youtube therefore none of the row in this pattern will make reference to a turning chain if you do not know how to do the no turning chain double_crochet or just plain don t like it you may substitute a ch3 for the first double_crochet of every row this pattern offers two variations on the theme if you want a more solid shawl you can work the pattern without the eyelet row if you want eyelet row are more irregular intervals you can do that too note an eyelet row can only be done after a wedge with an even # of sts otherwise it won t work begin with magic_ring row 1 work 7dc in magic_ring row 2 double_crochet in first st * ch1 double_crochet in next st * repeat from * to * to end of row 7dc 6 chain sps row
